info.headline: Heat Advisory issued August 01 at 2:38AM CDT until August 01 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 9 PM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Heat Advisory, overnight low temperatures will remain warm and not provide much relief from the heat. For the Excessive Heat Warning, dangerously hot conditions with peak daytime heat index values of 110 degrees or greater are expected. * WHERE...Little River County, Hempstead County and Nevada County. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, until 10 AM CDT this morning. For the Excessive Heat Warning, from 10 AM this morning to 9 PM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
